attributes.action: Prevent NHS basing eating disorder treatment on low BMI, by providing more funds
attributes.background:
Currently, when people approach GP's due to eating disorders, many are turned away due to not having a low enough BMI.
With increased NHS funding, people can be given access to the treatment they need before it's too late; radically reducing the number of lives lost due to these deadly illnesses.
attributes.additional_details:
B-eat, the leading eating disorder charity estimated that in 2015, 725,000 people in the UK were affected by eating disorders; with Anorexia nervosa having the highest mortality rate of all mental disorders. 

According to the NHS, 1 day, for 1 patient in hospital costs around £400. Therefore, money would be saved by giving people the access to treatment they need, before they reach the point of needing a hospital admission; which can last months.

attributes.action: Make the swegway/hoverboard no longer governed by the highways act of 1835.
attributes.background: The highways act of 1835 was clearly not written with the swegway in mind. They are smaller than a baby's pram and a disability scooter and people are allowed to use them in public, so it is unjust for the swegway to be singled out and banned in public places.
attributes.additional_details: At the very least they should be legal in public parks as bikes, being much faster than a swegway, are allowed to be in parks but swegways are not.

attributes.action: Remove roadside signs supported on steel girders
attributes.background: As a retained firefighter for Hampshire Fire and Rescue Service I have recently attended  an rtc where a van came into contact with a roadside motorway sign which was mounted on steel girders. This collision left the driver with life changing injuries. There are a number of these signs on the m3.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the construction of these signs is a danger to life and there appears to be more lightweight options available that are in use in other areas of the motorway system. A vehicle coming into contact with these signs supported on steel girders will quiet simply be cut in half by the force of the collision. I recently attended an incident on the m3 near Basingstoke where a driver lost a leg.

attributes.action: Change law so a learner can ride a 250cc motorcycle once passed car test or CBT.
attributes.background:
Please change the law for learner motorcycle riders.
Please change from 125cc to 250cc for learner riders. 
Many accidents happen due to mopeds having small wheels.
It's pretty easy for the front wheel to slip away on a corner. Bikes with larger wheel don't usually have this problem.
attributes.additional_details:
This would also help the environment as 4stroke engines would be available. These are much cleaner with less pollutants entering the atmosphere.
If publicised right it could mean less cars on the already busy roads.

attributes.action: Those with IBD to be allowed parking spaces outside their home
attributes.background: There are an estimated 300,000 people living with IBD in the UK, and not all of these people can register as disabled. This means that those who don't have a driveway or a designated parking space outside their home can struggle to park and get inside quickly when suffering a flare up.
attributes.additional_details:
A painted bay, or a designated parking space outside a sufferer's home would make a great difference.
It's not just IBD, there are thousands of people within the UK that suffer from chronic illness that would benefit from a parking space outside their home.
Local councils will not help as some sufferers cannot register as disabled, and therefore are not legally obliged to help and in may cases won't.
We're not asking to park in disabled bays, just the ability to park outside our own homes.

attributes.action: Cash for gold to check all items for smart water.
attributes.background:
My mum has been burgled twice in 18 months. After the first time she had purchased smart water to mark her possessions. 
Smart water can be purchased to mark jewellery or any other item which Is high in value. This cannot been seen by the naked eye, but under ultraviolet black light.
attributes.additional_details: Smart water is a non hazardous liquid, which leaves a long lasting and unique identifier on any item.

attributes.action: Abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.
attributes.background:
There has been a steady rise in animal abuse in the last few years. In 2011 there was a 23.5% rise in convictions and this is rising.
Many people who have committed these are known for committing  other crimes.
attributes.additional_details: Sign our petition if you think abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.

attributes.action: Justine Greening to bring back GCSE and AS/A2 ICT development.
attributes.background: We urgently need to develop the current GCSE and AS/A2 ICT courses to meet the needs of those students who want to use ICT skills in the workplace. The Computing alternatives do not provide workplace training suitable for the majority of jobs. Digital skills are still needed.

attributes.action: Make CPD (Continual professional development) mandatory for the beauty industry.
attributes.background: Most professions in the UK (Dentists, Doctors, Solicitors, Journalists etc... require a minimum number of CPD (Continual Professional Development training hours) to be completed each year. This is training to keep updated in your industry.
attributes.additional_details: The beauty industry needs skilled therapists that are dedicated to improving their skills and remained up-to-date in health and safety of the benefit of both themselves, their clients and the image of this massive industry.

attributes.action: Harsher penalties for racially abusing foreigners, blacks, Muslims and Asians.
attributes.background: Having seen people being racist and xenophobic towards foreigners, blacks, Muslims and Asians on the TV and in newspapers, it has angered me and I have had enough of it. I would like to see harsher penalties introduced to help reduce hate crime in the UK.

attributes.action: Reduce corporation tax to less than 12.5% give companies a reason to stay in UK
attributes.background: Post Brexit vote we need immediate action from the government as many companies will already be planning to leave the UK. Time is of the essence and we need to halt a mass exodus of  businesses and secure jobs for Britain. In-party politics should take second place to measures such as this.

attributes.action: Make GCSE politics and law compulsory.
attributes.background: The EU referendum results showed that people are easily manipulated by media and propaganda and should have a good basis understanding of law and politics before they should be able to decide the future of the country.

attributes.action: Secure permanent right to reside in the UK for any NHS employee on 23/06/16.
attributes.background: We the undersigned wish that answering 'yes' to the question "Were you working in the NHS on 23/06/16?" means auto-qualification for any future British status.
attributes.additional_details: We cannot risk losing the important foreign peoples that we as a nation have been fortunate enough to bring to the UK and in particular the NHS. Our health would be worse without them and it is imperative that the UK should recognise their importance to our nation by offering them unlimited free passage in to, from and between our country and others.

attributes.action: Make disabled spaces legally enforceable and a legal requirement.
attributes.background: While there are disabled bays provided at most buildings with parking, there is no legal requirement to provide them. The spaces are often abused; disabled drivers can very often not get parked in a bay with the space they need to get in and out, and which is close to the entrance.
attributes.additional_details:
Request

I would like two things. Firstly, I would like to see it made a legal requirement for buildings with parking spaces to provide disabled slots.

Secondly, I would like to see it made an offence to park in a disabled space without the appropriate authority - e.g. a blue badge for instance.

attributes.action: Use government resources to co-ordinate a modern Buy British campaign.
attributes.background: We can make and grow world-class produce and services in the UK.  Buying British is the most effective way to avoid recession now and spur long-term GDP growth regardless of EU membership.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age in the UK to 28
attributes.background: Due to the level of immaturity shown by the majority  of young people today, lack of respect and generation culture, i feel that at 18, youth dont have not enough experience  to make  judgements that could possibly lead to a nations future.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of participation in national referendum, as low as 28%, meaning they either lack the fundamental knowledge or they just cant be bothered.

attributes.action: Free prescription charges for, Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
attributes.background: Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome are auto-immune diseases effecting more than 500,000 people in the UK. Currently there is no cure, so the only way to manage the pain and flare up's is to take medication, taking 20 tablets+ daily.
attributes.additional_details: I am petitioning for, any Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome/Lupus sufferers to be given free prescriptions and and all above named conditions be added to the NHS exemption list. These conditions can affect any of us, no matter what age. Having to pay for prescriptions or prescription-pre-payment cards till you are 60 is not fair, they need to be added to the medical exemption format.

attributes.action: Make its so cars don't have to have their number plates on the front.
attributes.background: I don't see it fair that motorbikes are aloud to ride around the uk streets with just a back number plate and no front one, so I think that cars should only have to have a back number plate aswell.

attributes.action: now that the British people have voted , we need an updated  magna carta
attributes.background: now that the British people have voted to leave the eu, one of the wrongs needs to be righted, a British bill of rights is needed to include an updated people's magna Carta to include the original laws but updated for the 21st century, also if possible to be signed &  agreed by the head of state
attributes.additional_details: the magna Carta was signed by the then head of state king John, to protect the people's rights for lawful imgresses, parts of the laws were watered down or revoked by various people over the centuries, therefore losing said rights, but some still stand as of today & as this was the peoples choice to leave the eu, those in charge, parliment etc, should now be held accountable by the said people as/if the  need arises

attributes.action: Propose a referendum on whether or not HM Government should trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the fact UK citizens can now see it's effect more clearly and are better informed of future plans, we the undersigned propose HM Government hold a further referendum on whether or not to trigger Article50. The result of this should then determine a 2nd referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is due to the sheer number of people expressing they voted incorrectly to leave, some as a "dissatisfaction" vote and the fact the vote was too close to be a satisfactory result. Also the backtracking on spending proposals (eg NHS) clearly left many feeling deceived by the out campaign. UK citizens deserve honesty and integrity from their leaders to make truely informed decisions and that did not happen.

attributes.action: Call a legally binding Euro referendum, 16+ voting age, 2-week campaign.
attributes.background: The non-binding referendum on UK membership of the EU resulted in a majority for 'Leave'. The consequences are becoming apparent. Since the UK has not yet triggered Clause 50, we should re-run the referendum with slightly changed rules, so that voters can decide based on the evidence at hand.
attributes.additional_details: Both sides' campaigns were unsatisfactory in providing objective information about the consequences of deciding to stay or leave. While voters accept exaggeration and distortion of facts during election campaigns, the consequences are generally short-term and reversible due to the 5-year terms of governments. For the EU referendum, however, the consequences are permanent and irreversible. A number of key 'pledges' have already been disowned by Leave campaigners, and some real-life consequences of Brexit have already become apparent. UK voters should take this information into account, and decide what they want.

attributes.action: Lower the Voting Age to 15 so 15-17 year olds can vote.
attributes.background: I think that people aged 15 and above should have the right to vote in future Referendums and Prime Minister Elections. Young adults are taught in Schools about Politics and the Government so they will have a clear understanding of why and what they are voting for.

attributes.action: Make PM & Cabinet legally and personally liable for election promises.
attributes.background: As shown in the recent referendum, it has become too easy for campaign promises to be ditched and forgotten. That implies that victors are elected on platforms that they are not willing to or that are impossible to achieve. PM/Cabinet must therefore be held to account both as institution and person.

attributes.action: A referendum should not be retaken for the same issue for at least 10years
attributes.background:
Following the recent vote leave result, a law should be passed preventing the Re-Polling of the same subject for a minimum period of time. I suggest this should be 10 years. 
Once the general public have had their democratic say, this should not be undermined by a second referendum.

attributes.action: Implement a 2nd EU Referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the HM Government to debate and implement a second referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote as the results effect everyone not only voters aged 18 and over.

attributes.action: Make all Diesel power plant applications require Environmental Impact Assessment
attributes.background: There are £175m in subsidies to build heavily polluting diesel power plants to provide the UK with backup energy generating capacity. Bizarrely these require less Environmental impact assessment than a single wind turbine.

attributes.action: Bring the perpetrators of rape in the Democratic Republic of Congo to justice.
attributes.background:
Young girls and I mean young [under 5 in some cases] are being taken from their homes gang rapped and then left. 

I would like the UK to put pressure on the Congo offering police help if needed to stop this wave of rape and oppression of young girls.
attributes.additional_details:
You can see the story here
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/20/girls-gang-raped-suspects-free-democratic-republic-congo-president-kabila?CMP=share_btn_fb

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any MP to tell lies in Parliament, or to the Public.
attributes.background: It is totally unfair that MP's can consider that their jobs allows them to be dishonest with both Parliament, and the General Public, with no consequences.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at how many MP's have been accused of lying in the Euro Debate.  How are the Public meant to know what to vote for, when all they are hearing are called lies!

attributes.action: To make August Bank Holiday Monday reclassified as ‘England Day.’
attributes.background: Given the rich and illustrious history of England, I propose that this day be given a new name and purpose and call it 'England Day?’ By a stroke of good fortune, historical evidence suggests that this time of year coincides with the emergence of England as single sovereign state, 1091 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Living in England is a great privilege and we should celebrate this. The transition from Bank Holiday Monday to England Day, couldn’t be simpler or more convenient, coming in late summer it would be part of the three-day holiday. This proposal is not competing with St George’s Day. This proposal seeks to promote a public holiday that already exists, by giving it status and relevance. If this idea appeals to you, please add your name to the petition.

attributes.action: Oppose Wigan Council Application No. A/16/82503/CU
attributes.background: Wigan Council is planning on converting Evolution Nightclub / 36-44 King Street Wigan into restaurants, cafes and residential units. This will seriously damage the nightlife in Wigan and cause many job losses. King street is made up of bars and clubs and employs hundreds of people.
attributes.additional_details: If this plan goes ahead, it will mean that the bars and clubs on King street may receive noise complaints and may have to reduce their noise levels and operating hours. Wigan cannot afford any more unemployment in the town and many of the staff are now worried that they could lose their jobs over this. King street is dependant on its nightlife and see's 1000's of customers every week. Having a residential area in the middle of the street is only the start of what negative's it will bring

attributes.action: Lobby FIFA to remove World Cup 2018 from current hosts Russia
attributes.background: A recent history of racist and homophobic chants and threats at Russian stadia, plus the well planned and brutal attacks on England fans at Euro 2016 strongly suggests Russia is a very poor choice to host World Cup 2018. The UK Government alongside the English FA should pressure FIFA to move it.
attributes.additional_details: Russian 'fans' have organised attacks during Euro 2016 resulting in serious injuries http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36515213. A Russian MP has backed the attacks, "I see nothing wrong with football fans fighting. On the contrary, well done to our boys! Keep up the good work!" https://twitter.com/Russian1972/status/742256350424641536). FARE has documented incidents of racists & homophobic nature in Russian football http://www.farenet.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/SOVA-monitoring-report.pdf

attributes.action: Public Inquiry and full disclosure of corrupt covert operations
attributes.background:
Request for:
- Public Inquiry
- Full disclosure of official files 
of crimes by State of Human Rights violations against innocent individuals and / or their families subjected to misuse of covert operations and secrets act (including removal of exclusion notices to the innocent person's file).
attributes.additional_details: A person or family to be placed under covert operations must be a threat to national security by government, law enforcement, secret and security organisation, such as espionage, serious crimes and terrorism.  An innocent person exercising their legal rights in any context that is to democratic laws / policy is not a threat to State. Neither should be subjected to misuse of covert operations and their Human Rights violated.  All records collated constitute criminal evidence by such contravention.

attributes.action: Place more stringent requirements on school meals that are served at break.
attributes.background: Currently, at our school, the main meals are healthy, the menu varies and the quality of the produce is high, but as not all of the standards on health, quality and variety apply to break food, the same things are served every day. Fruit is there, but this is expensive and placed in a corner.
attributes.additional_details:
All school health standards should be applied to all meal servings, along with more defined legislation regarding variety and quality, especially for food served at mid-morning break. This will allow students to eat healthier options, eat a variety​ of food and know what they are consuming, no matter the time, is of high quality.

Food served at mid-morning break includes:
Pizza slices
Belgian Waffles - which are sprinkled in sugar
Donuts
Paninis
Bacon and cheese rolls - where there is 1cm of fat on each piece of bacon

attributes.action: Make all UK schools enforce their school bullying policies legally
attributes.background: Schools legally have to have bullying policies but they do not legally have to enforce their policies as they currently only have discretionary meaning. They legally don't have any powers to enforce their policies and this has to be changed for safety well-being of all children's no 1 priority.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics released say 1.5 million pupils are bullied verbally or physically or both in the last 12 months which was on national news TV etc. Therefore it's children's and pupils' lives that are being ruined and destroyed and society in general and schools are failing to act cause of current policies and legislations and have no powers.
attributes.creator_name: Stephen McCulloch On Behalf Of Anti Bullying Ambassadors

attributes.action: Introduce the drinking age of 21
attributes.background:
Alcohol has many side affects. It's scientifically proved that it can damage the devolving brain cells of the teenagers.
However the majority of 21 year old are fully developed, therefore the effects of alcohol upon the brain is significantly lower.

attributes.action: Adopt British summer Time from mid February to mid November.
attributes.background:
Almost nobody looks forward to the clocks going back, at the end of October, and despite this, we persist with this oppressive schedule.  
My proposal is to adopt BST from Mid Feb to mid Nov. shortening the dark winter evenings.  I believe this would be very good for national morale.
attributes.additional_details:
It is said that the mornings are too dark in Scotland.  On the current regime, it is broad daylight in Edinburgh at 8.00 am by the end of January.  As a Scot, I am sure that mid February would be a good moment to move to BST.  It is a long haul through to the end of March. 
 
Light at the end of the day is far more useful for healthy recreation and exercise, and environmentally, less energy would be used with lighter evenings, because more people are up and about in the afternoon.

attributes.action: Do not cut NHS unsociable hours pay.
attributes.background:
There is talk about fresh contracts to be implemented for the rest of the NHS staff. Due to the national shortage of healthcare professionals and workers, it would not be feasible to cut pay further. 
A lot of NHS staff rely on unsociable hours pay, to feed their families and so forth.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS needs a revamp and a boost, but not at the expense of front-line staff. It is not ideal to venture down this path and it would be an idea to explore other options, as opposed to cutting people's pay. The NHS also needs to encourage future employees and this is a solution, to a recruitment problem.

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of the Zeilsdorf Family from Laggan.
attributes.background: The family are waiting for imminent deportation as they have failed to meet the criteria of their Entrepreneur Visa by employing 2 people in their tiny shop and coffee bothy in Laggan. They do employ 1, they have 3 children, and take care of the local rural community by providing a valuable service.
attributes.additional_details: They are being forced to leave before they can sell. There's every chance that the business will not continue and the area will lose it's shop. Other similar services are tens of miles away. Their children are Scottish, they employ someone, and they make regular visits to local elderly and house bound people in the community as Jason was a Pastor. It is not the Highlands, Scotland or Scottish people who don't want and them; it is just the Home Office. We NEED them - sign  to keep the Zeilsdorfs.

attributes.action: Invest more money into front line policing increase number of response officers
attributes.background:
More and more officers are being assaulted each year. With the lack of numbers it will soon become a huge safety issue. 

On top of that, too often we hear the story that response officers to not have the time, resources or funding to deal with/investigate an offence.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 saw a police officer assaulted every 22 minutes in England & Wales. This is a growing number and we need to invest to protect not only the public from these damaging cuts but the officers themselves.

attributes.action: Change Immigration rules for non eu partners.
attributes.background:
Get rid of the financial requirements so that non eu partners can able to stay and work in the uk.
The only requirements need to be married or have a family with british national.
However, both of them can not claim any benefits or funds for 2 years.
attributes.additional_details:
I am british and married with japanese national.  My spouse can not stay and work in the uk because we can not  meet financial requirements. 
It's very unfair system for british national with non eu partners.

attributes.action: Ban advertising of alcohol, restrict opening times, picture of damaged liver
attributes.background:
In September of this year my partner Claire died due to long term alcohol dependancy, more or less my last words to Claire was that I was going to try and help others in the same situation. 

Being alcohol dependant doesn't just effect the person it also effects close family and friends
attributes.additional_details:
What people don't realise is what damage drinking too much  alcohol can do, in many cases people with liver disease don't have any noticeable symptoms until their live is badly damaged. 
Those systems are.
Jaundice,Oadema, swelling in abdomen, itchy skin, weakness and muscle wasting,insomnia nose bleeds and bleeding gums.
To give you some figures on alcohol abuse it cost the NHS  £2000 per day for a level 3 patient on intensive care It is commonly said that it costs overall to the society £21 bn

attributes.action: to give emotional support animals (dogs, cats) the same status as a service dog.
attributes.background: A emotional support animal is a animal that lives with a person with anxiety, ptsd, depression and people with social anxiety. the ESA accompanies the person wherever they go to reduce stress, anxiety or episodes of social anxiety and need it to be made compulsary to allow access to all buildings
attributes.additional_details: assistance dog owners have important rights under the Equality Act 2010 (EA). The EA provides for people with disabilities to have the same right to services supplied by shops, banks, hotels, libraries, pubs, taxis and restaurants as everyone else. It is against the law for service providers to treat people with disabilities less favourably because of their disability, or because they have a guide or assistance dog with them. this should be the same for emotional support cats & dogs.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to require disclosure of current  salary on a job application
attributes.background: Candidates are often dismissed as unsuitable if their current salary is more than 10% removed from the salary of the role they are applying for.  This discourages career advancement as well as job mobility between industries with different pay grades.  Candidates should be assessed on merit alone.
attributes.additional_details: Employers use current salary as a baseline to make an offer to a successful candidate, leading to a situation where two candidates can be paid vastly different amounts for the same role – this discourages social mobility and gender equality by ensuring that employees who are paid less than their colleagues are unable to catch up even when moving jobs.   Candidates can also fail to be considered for a role if their current salary is not in the same range as the role they are applying for.

attributes.action: Free sanitary products for public restrooms so homeless women can still get them
attributes.background: Homeless woman are less likely to get these products as they will have to choose between food or these products, if we had free ones in public restrooms it would help them in the long run.

attributes.action: All products with gelatine must be labelled clearly,animal or vegetable gelatine
attributes.background: There are many products on the market which contain gelatine. Gelatine is found in our foods, sweets and in our pharmaceutical products,these are just a few examples. Clear labelling on EVERY product that contains gelatine and what type of gelatine it is, be it from animals or vegetables.

attributes.action: Sellers should complete building survey before the property goes on the market
attributes.background: When selling a property the building survey should be completed by the seller before it can go on the market, so that all parties involved are aware of any serious defects.This would expediate the process for buyers, who often only discover the property's faults late in the process, but also sellers
attributes.additional_details: Although the current rules are supposed to offer protection, as Sellers are meant to inform Buyers of serious defects if a previous sale has fallen through etc this is often not enforced. Instead late in the process, after the Buyer has already paid for a host of surveys, the true cost of the property becomes apparent. Having the survey completed first would make everyone aware of all issues at the start of the process, making life easier for all involved.

attributes.action: Personally apologise to HM Forces personnel dismissed due to their sexuality.
attributes.background:
Thousands of serving gay military personnel suffered intrusive investigations into their sexuality, losing homes, careers and friends. Many faced homelessness, rejection and no suitable alternative career. Many experience unemployment and poor mental health, even now.
We demand a personal apology.
attributes.additional_details:
Not one individual subjected to investigation and dismissal from HM Forces, has ever received an apology. 
In 2007, the MOD provided a watery statement of recognition, but  many didn't know about it and it certainly wasn't personal. 
There is a moral obligation to apologise for this treatment. The effects of these investigations are still very real for these people.
Given the law in this area was only repealed in the 2016 revision of the Armed Forces Bill, the time is right to apologise.

attributes.action: liquid vapours for e cigs to be hidden behind shutters like cigarettes
attributes.background: Im a non smoking mum who knows many young children getting hooked on e cigs & vapour pens, which no doubt will continue onto cigarettes. Liquid vapour needs to be behind shutters like cigarettes. Currently being advertised like sweets in a sweetie shop. Needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently caught my 11 yr old son  a vapour pen! I discovered that most of the yr 6 in primary school were smoking. Advertising is aimed at kids lemon soufflé, trifle, bubble gum & Coca Cola flavours. Once hooked they will Start smoking cigarettes to increase the tobacco industry sales. 
Today most people are trying to quit smoking so hence tobacco sales declining. The tobacco industry are now hoping to encourage younger generation. These liquid vapours need to be behind closed doors.

attributes.action: Train more doctors.
attributes.background: To meet future demands for healthcare, whilst managing the hours worked by doctors, we need more doctors.  There are currently lots of talented people who want to train as doctors but can't because there are not enough places at medical schools.
attributes.additional_details: As well as increasing the number of training places available to people aged 18, the number of places available to people in their 20's (both with and without a first degree in another subject) should be significantly increased to improve access to medicine as a career.  Currently to secure a place at medical school you have to demonstate an excellent academic record, a committment to medicine and a track record of helping others, usually by the age of 17.

attributes.action: Impose restrictions on corner shops / off-licence shops using plastic bags.
attributes.background: We saw clear decline of using plastic bags after imposing 5p charge which benefit the environment a great deal. It is time to impose restrictions or small charge on corner shops / takeaways /  off-licence shops  etc.This will further cut out the mess on our streets and will benefit small business
